title: [GAMEPLAY] Matchmaking creating unbalanced teams every game? (I know I sound like a baby but...)
body:
Yesterday I had a 75ish % winrate on Teemo and 100% on Garen (for the last 20 ranked games). Point I'm trying to make is I'm not a *bad* player. Earlier today (around the time Riot started "investigating issues with matchmaking"), I started losing *every game*. And not just losing. These were stomps. All five enemies were going 15/1/20 while my team lost horribly, like the kind of losing that you would get flamed for if EVERYONE weren't also losing. In case you don't believe me, here are some links:
https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2824630358/238192276?tab=overview
https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2824637261/238192276?tab=overview
(^Teemo vs Garen, should have been an easy win)
https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2825164559/238192276?tab=overview

If this turns out to be just me sucking, or bad luck, or whatever, then that's fine. But, like, if it's a bug, I just wanna stop losing, ya know? Because usually at least one opponent gets fed and one of my teammates dcs, but I can deal with that as long as we have some chance. Idk but please respond riot

Something is wrong as well with normal games.

So far today every game I've had people with gold/plat borders who out and out feed, die, etc - now, every now and then this happens but this is happening -every single game- right now.  The last three games I had, my team had gold/plat getting destroyed and keep in mind, this is not ranked.  This is NORMAL matches, and this shouldn't be allowed to happen.  This has been going on all day long, and they need to make an announcement about it and fix it.  Is this a not so subtle jab to tell us to play ranked only or what?  I'm embarrassed for you Riot, honestly.

Thank goodness, I'm not crazy! It's been happening to me in ranked too though (which makes me sad but I was already at 0LP after moving up a tier earlier in the week, so I didn't lose any LP thankfully).

It is all luck man. In a perfect dream world, every game would be 5 people playing perfectly of evenly match skill where the tiniest mistake in the end is the only deciding factor, a true nailbiter of games, but this is the real world. You can't expect five random people to play perfectly every game. It isn't Riot trying to punish you, or hate you, or whatever, there are too many factors to get both teams even and too many factors beyond that to ensue that your allies don't feed.
